text: What is AMPscript in Salesforce Marketing Cloud?

possibleAnswers.text: A proprietary scripting language from Salesforce used to personalize content in emails, web pages, and SMS within Marketing Cloud.
A tool to automate email campaigns on any marketing platform.
A specific module for managing analytics in Marketing Cloud.
The standard language for creating landing pages in any CRM.

text: What is the difference between AMPscript and SSJS in Marketing Cloud?

possibleAnswers.text: There is no difference, they are two names for the same language.
AMPscript is a proprietary Salesforce language and is processed in real-time, while SSJS is a JavaScript implementation that is processed on the server before sending the content.
SSJS only works in emails and AMPscript only works on web pages.
AMPscript is for junior developers and SSJS is for experts.

text: What are Data Extensions in Marketing Cloud?

possibleAnswers.text: Relational tables similar to SQL tables that store data for use in Marketing Cloud.
Advanced AMPscript functions to extend data.
A method to connect Marketing Cloud with external databases.
Custom reports on subscriber activity.

text: What is the function of the %%[ ]%% tag in AMPscript?

possibleAnswers.text: Delimiting AMPscript code blocks in emails and web pages for processing.
Indicating to the system to ignore that content during sending.
Dynamically inserting images into emails.
Creating global variables usable throughout the platform.

text: What is Journey Builder in Salesforce Marketing Cloud?

possibleAnswers.text: A tool for designing email templates.
A system for managing subscriber lists.
A visual tool that allows you to create automated multi-channel customer experiences based on events and data.
A system for visualizing the historical journey of customers.

text: How do you access data from a Data Extension using AMPscript?

possibleAnswers.text: Using only the DataExtension() function.
With functions like Lookup(), LookupRows(), LookupOrderedRows() or LookupRowsCS().
Only through the Content Builder user interface.
Using exclusively SQL Query Activity.

text: What is Content Builder in Marketing Cloud?

possibleAnswers.text: A tool for managing CRM integrations.
An email campaign analysis system.
A centralized tool for creating, managing, and delivering content in Marketing Cloud.
An exclusive editor for HTML code.

text: How are variables handled in AMPscript?

possibleAnswers.text: Using the $ sign as a prefix for all variables.
They are declared with SET @variableName = value and accessed using @ as a prefix.
You cannot create variables in AMPscript, only use existing data.
Using let or var as in standard JavaScript.

text: What is Automation Studio in Marketing Cloud?

possibleAnswers.text: A tool for creating responsive design templates.
A tool for creating, managing, and executing automated marketing activities that can include data imports, segmentations, sends, and more.
An advanced editor exclusively for AMPscript.
A system for scheduling email sends only.

text: What is the ContentBlockByID() function in AMPscript?

possibleAnswers.text: A function that only allows displaying images saved in Content Builder.
A function that allows you to insert content from a specific Content Block using its ID as a reference.
A function for dynamically creating new content blocks.
A tool for updating existing content in the database.

text: What is the main difference between Script.Util.HttpRequest in SSJS and using HTTPGet() in AMPscript?

possibleAnswers.text: Script.Util.HttpRequest in SSJS offers more configuration options and greater flexibility for complex API calls, while HTTPGet() in AMPscript is simpler but more limited.
There is no functional difference between the two.
HTTPGet() is faster and always preferable.
Script.Util.HttpRequest only works in CloudPages.

text: What are CloudPages in Marketing Cloud?

possibleAnswers.text: Campaign report pages for clients.
Web pages hosted in Marketing Cloud that can use AMPscript, SSJS, and other platform functionalities.
An exclusive system for storing images in the cloud.
The old name for Content Builder.

text: What are Salesforce Data Extensions and how do they relate to Marketing Cloud?

possibleAnswers.text: They are generic data tables with no relation to Salesforce CRM.
They are special Data Extensions that automatically synchronize data between Salesforce CRM and Marketing Cloud using Marketing Cloud Connect.
They are predefined templates for email campaigns.
They are code extensions to customize the user interface.

text: How is the try-catch structure used in SSJS?

possibleAnswers.text: SSJS does not support try-catch exception handling.
It only works with database errors.
It is used as in standard JavaScript: try { code that may fail } catch(error) { error handling }, allowing you to capture and manage errors elegantly.
It requires a special license for use in Marketing Cloud.

text: What advantages does using SSJS offer over AMPscript in Marketing Cloud?

possibleAnswers.text: SSJS always executes faster than AMPscript.

SSJS offers a familiar syntax for those who know JavaScript, support for arrays and complex objects, and access to additional APIs such as Platform and Core to interact with Marketing Cloud components.
SSJS is compatible with all browsers without limitations.
SSJS allows sending emails without the need for Journey Builder.

text: What is the purpose of the Marketing Cloud SDK?

possibleAnswers.text: To create custom apps that integrate with Marketing Cloud.
To design email templates only.
To analyze email performance.
To create website pop-ups.

text: What is a Landing Page in Marketing Cloud?

possibleAnswers.text: A page shown only on mobile devices.
A web page hosted in Marketing Cloud designed to capture leads or provide specific information to recipients.
The first page users see when logging into Marketing Cloud.
A feature exclusively for Enterprise accounts.

text: What is the v() function in AMPscript used for?

possibleAnswers.text: It's used for validating email addresses.
It's an alternate way to output variable values without concatenation.
It's used for versioning AMPscript code.
It's only used in CloudPages for visualization.

text: What is the purpose of the CreateSendEvent() function in AMPscript?

possibleAnswers.text: It's only used to create new email templates.
It sends an email using a triggered send definition.
It creates a new event in Automation Studio.
It schedules email sends for a later date.

text: What is MobilePush in Marketing Cloud?

possibleAnswers.text: A feature to optimize email rendering on mobile devices.
A solution for creating and sending push notifications to mobile app users.
A feature to push data between Marketing Cloud instances.
A tool to design mobile websites.

text: How do you debug SSJS code in Marketing Cloud?

possibleAnswers.text: Using browser developer tools like in normal JavaScript.
Using Write() or Platform.Response.Write() to output variable values and debug information to the page or email.
Using a built-in debugger in Marketing Cloud Studio.
Debugging is not possible in SSJS.

text: What are Guide Template Language (GTL) and Content Blocks in Marketing Cloud?

possibleAnswers.text: GTL is a proprietary language used for creating templates, and Content Blocks are reusable pieces of content stored in Content Builder.
They are outdated technologies no longer used in Marketing Cloud.
GTL is only used in Journey Builder, and Content Blocks are exclusive to Email Studio.
They are the same thing with different names.

text: What are event-driven triggers in Marketing Cloud?

possibleAnswers.text: Triggers are used only for scheduling emails.

They only work for mobile push notifications.

text: How does the Platform.Function.ParseJSON method work in SSJS?

possibleAnswers.text: It only works for simple JSON structures.
It's not available in Marketing Cloud SSJS.
It converts a JSON string into a JavaScript object that can be manipulated in SSJS code.
It requires specific permissions to use.

text: What is the difference between Shared and Local Data Extensions?

possibleAnswers.text: There is no difference technically, only in their naming convention.
Shared Data Extensions are accessible across business units while Local Data Extensions are accessible only within the business unit where they're created.
Local Data Extensions can only store customer data.
Shared Data Extensions are read-only.

text: What is the purpose of the Upsert method in SSJS Data Extensions?

possibleAnswers.text: It's only used for deleting rows in a Data Extension.
It is a combination of 'update' and 'insert' that will update a record if it exists based on the primary key, or insert a new record if it doesn't exist.
It only sorts data in a Data Extension.
It's used to create new Data Extensions programmatically.

text: What is the ContentAreaByName() function in AMPscript used for?

possibleAnswers.text: It's only used for retrieving images from Content Builder.
It retrieves a content area from Classic Content by its name for use in an email or page.
It's a function for creating new content areas dynamically.
It extracts text from Content Builder blocks.

text: What are Behavioral Triggers in Marketing Cloud?

They're exclusively for mobile push notifications.

Using IF/ELSEIF/ELSE statements, FOR loops, and WHILE loops to create conditional branching logic and iterations.
Only by using external JavaScript.
Only through Content Builder interface wizards.

text: What is Einstein in Marketing Cloud?

Salesforce's AI technology that provides predictive intelligence, recommendations, and automation capabilities in Marketing Cloud to enhance personalization and optimization.

A premium email sending service.

text: What is the proper way to use ContentBlockByKey() in AMPscript?

possibleAnswers.text: It can only be used in emails, not in CloudPages.
ContentBlockByKey('content-key') retrieves a content block from Content Builder using its external key, and can be used across business units when set up correctly.
It's only for retrieving image content.
It requires special permissions to use.

text: How do you handle asynchronous operations in SSJS?

possibleAnswers.text: Using promises and async/await just like in modern JavaScript.
SSJS does not support true asynchronous operations; all code executes synchronously. For API calls, you must use blocking methods and handle responses sequentially.
Using setTimeout() functions.
Only by implementing custom JavaScript libraries.

text: What are Business Units in Marketing Cloud?

text: What is a Suppression List in Marketing Cloud?

A list of deprecated features in Marketing Cloud.

text: What is the role of Sender Authentication Package (SAP) in Marketing Cloud?

possibleAnswers.text: It's only used for account security within Marketing Cloud.
It establishes trusted sending domains, improves deliverability, and provides brand consistency by authenticating email sending domains through DKIM, SenderID, and custom sending domains.

It's only for tracking email opens and clicks securely.

text: What is the importance of IP Warming in Marketing Cloud?

possibleAnswers.text: It's a process to increase server performance during peak sending times.
It's a gradual process of establishing a positive sending reputation for new IP addresses by incrementally increasing email volume over time to improve deliverability.
It's a technical check to ensure IP addresses are properly configured.
It's only relevant for companies sending more than 10 million emails daily.

text: What are Data Filters in Marketing Cloud?

possibleAnswers.text: Tools used only for data validation during imports.
Saved SQL queries that can be applied to Data Extensions to segment data without creating new Data Extensions.
Security features that prevent unauthorized data access.
Compression algorithms to reduce database size.

text: What is the purpose of Google Analytics 360 integration with Marketing Cloud?

possibleAnswers.text: It's only used for tracking email opens and clicks.

text: What is the purpose of the Query Activity in Automation Studio?

text: What are the key considerations for email deliverability in Marketing Cloud?

possibleAnswers.text: Only email design and content matter for deliverability.
Key factors include proper authentication (SPF, DKIM, DMARC), IP reputation management, engagement-based sending, list hygiene, content quality, and compliance with anti-spam laws.
Deliverability is only determined by the sending volume.
Deliverability is only influenced by the email service provider's reputation.

text: What is Distributed Marketing in Salesforce Marketing Cloud?

text: What is the role of Data Designer in Marketing Cloud?

text: What is the significance of RFM (Recency, Frequency, Monetary) analysis in Marketing Cloud?

possibleAnswers.text: It's only used for technical performance monitoring.

A customer segmentation approach that analyzes how recently a customer purchased (Recency), how often they purchase (Frequency), and how much they spend (Monetary) to identify high-value customers and tailor marketing strategies accordingly.
A coding framework specific to Marketing Cloud development.
A reporting standard for email campaign metrics.

text: What are Customer Data Platforms (CDPs) and how do they relate to Marketing Cloud?

possibleAnswers.text: CDPs are only relevant for non-Salesforce customers.

Customer Data Platforms are systems that create unified customer databases accessible to other systems; Salesforce CDP integrates with Marketing Cloud to provide a complete view of customers across all touchpoints for more personalized messaging.
CDPs are deprecated technologies replaced by Marketing Cloud.
CDPs are only focused on data collection, with no relation to marketing execution.
